segments.text: I see the water just pouring over the edge of the sink, and it’s spreading everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in it, but she doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s the most oblivious person I’ve ever seen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, but at least they’re not making the water situation worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy is really stretching to get those cookies, and I’m impressed by his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful, like she’s waiting for the best treat ever.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I love how excited she is, even if they’re being naughty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is a mix of chaos and innocence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
